Articles.Content: Also, seeing as I can't run ships larger than 600 parts for the time being, how many more parts will it handle when KSP turns 64 bit?

Hopefully a lot, I have a crappy CPU but a very decent GPU, I'm hoping the 64bit will help because my processor is limiting my part count below 300 parts before it goes down to 4 FPS (I usually play at 8 or 9)
I hope so, My new 'Temeraire' comes in at 446 parts:D
I'm always below 2fps so I don't notice the difference between 800 and 300.
I only notice a frame rate loss at 300 parts, so i try to keep it under 400. The Temeraire went over that but was over 600 before I got rid of the unnecessary junk.

Then shoot it against my destroyer.
I once thought about a war, lots of battles happening within days of each other between two people from different companies and the companies were in two alliances that were at war.

Also, could someone test my upgraded 'Achilles' Battleship?

Download:http://www./download/7855tbta2u0sy4j/%27Achilles%27+Class+Battleship.craft#39;Achilles'_Class_Battleship.craft

I once thought about a war, lots of battles happening within days of each other between two people from different companies and the companies were in two alliances that were at war.

That type of a battle would be really fun, although I'd structure it like this:

1. 4 or 6 Companies/Fleets

2. Alliances, with 2 corps per alliance/team to ensure an even start to a war.

3. 2 corps battle in orbit (one from each team), while two battle on the surface of a planet.

4. Battles would have to be won in orbit and on the surface to "Win" a battle, thereby forcing the losing alliance to move to another world.

5. Stalemates would be called in case of one alliance winning on the surface and the other in orbit, or vice versa. Then both alliances engage in full force (2v2) in the theater of combat that is agreed upon.

6. A best 2 out of 3, or similar thing would suffice to see if an alliance "won" the full war, but it could also be custom-tailored, such as having permadeath for units (once a unit is totaled, it can't be replaced), or having strategic objectives that count towards winning overall.

I think a upgraded/modified ruleset/rule expansion would make larger, team-based battles work and still be quite fun for everyone involved. Plus, it would make for great YouTube vids for people who can record!

I'll help set up a 2v2 or 3v3 once I finish my invasion of KSC against daeCorp, since it'll help prep me for future surface battles.
Nope, nope, nope. We're not doing that again we nearly got locked.

Trust me, I know that the rules are to be followed.
